page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: The houses are all built of the local limestone which is a creamy colour when new and weathers to a greyer shade. Most of the roofs are also stone tiled. Garden walls are built of the same stone. Some of the houses are very old, but styles have not changed very much so it is difficult to tell. According to David Verey's book 'Gloucestershire :the Cotswolds'in the buildings of England series published in 1970, about half the cottages are 17th century, the other half are 19th century. Some have inscribed stones,eg 'JM 1817' and' Sir J.M.Bart. 1841. The oldest one we found had the date 1698 on it. Most of the older houses have been modernised and are very nice to look at. The new houses are built in the same style so nothing looks odd or out of place. ( Cont.)
